elements.title: Bob Moses: ‘Time of Your Life’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Bob Moses: ‘Time of Your Life’

 Best New Music

After their surprise Coachella sets last month, Grammy-winning production/songwriting duo Bob Moses decided to let the hits keep coming.

May 16

elements.title: Annahstasia: ‘Be Kind’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Annahstasia: ‘Be Kind’

 Best New Music

Bewitching vocals ,luscious lyrics, classic jazz with a folk twist — all this and more is what you’ll hear in Annahstasia ’s “Be Kind.”

May 15

elements.title: Gatlin: ‘If She Was A Boy’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Gatlin: ‘If She Was A Boy’

 Best New Music

When the artist Gatlin was ready to write new material for her debut album, she knew that she needed to recruit some talented queer women to help. .

May 14

elements.title: Allison Russell ‘Superlover (Feat. Annie Lennox)’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Allison Russell ‘Superlover (Feat. Annie Lennox)’

 Best New Music

Singer, actor, and activist Allison Russell invited the legendary Annie Lennox to collaborate on a beautiful ballad that begs the question: How are you a “Superlover?”

May 13

elements.title: Cola Boyy ‘Walk Again’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Cola Boyy ‘Walk Again’

 Best New Music

Disco innovator and disability rights activist Cola Boyy ’s posthumous sophomore album, Quit To Play Chess, serves as a soundtrack against ableism and inequality.

May 12

elements.title: Brian Eno + Beatie Wolfe: ‘What We Are’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Brian Eno + Beatie Wolfe: ‘What We Are’

 Best New Music

Ambient music pioneer, visual artist, and thinker Brian Eno teams up with conceptual artist and composer Beatie Wolfe for two new albums coming to us on June 6.

May 9

elements.title: Chicarica: ‘Parará’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Chicarica: ‘Parará’

 Best New Music

Chilean synthpop trio Chicarica (Rich Girl) give us an enticing lead in to their sophomore album Invierno en la playa, due May 30th.

May 8

elements.title: Fitz & The Tantrums: ‘Ruin The Night’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Fitz & The Tantrums: ‘Ruin The Night’

 Best New Music

We first caught up with Fitz & The Tantrums back in 2009 when they played live on Morning Becomes Eclectic around the release of their debut album Songs For A Breakup: Volume 1.

May 7
